content.prompt: A researcher is investigating the claim that the proportion of television viewers who identify one of four shows as their favorite is the same for all four shows. A χ2 goodness-of-fit test at a significance level of α=0.05 produced the test statistic χ2=8.95 with a corresponding p-value of 0.03. Which of the following is correct?

choices.label: There is sufficient evidence to reject the null hypothesis at the 0.05 level since the test statistic is greater than the p-value.
There is not sufficient evidence to reject the null hypothesis at the 0.05 level since the test statistic is greater than the p-value.
There is sufficient evidence to reject the null hypothesis at the 0.05 level since the p-value is less than the significance level.
There is not sufficient evidence to reject the null hypothesis at the 0.05 level since the p-value is less than the significance level.
There is sufficient evidence to reject the null hypothesis at the 0.05 level since the test statistic is greater than the significance level.

topic.text: 8.3: Carrying out a Chi-Square Goodness of Fit Test

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Justify a claim using a decision based on significance tests.
